title.native: モンスターストライク

description:
An anime adaptation of the Monster Strike mobile game by mixi.

The protagonist, Ren Homura, returns to the town of Kaminohara, where he once lived. But did he really live in this place before? A nagging feeling tugs at his memories. Meanwhile, a strange game is forcefully installed onto his smartphone - a game called Monster Strike. A gauntlet of battles await him. Through the fierce fighting, he pieces together his scattered memories while uncovering the truth of the game. He's supported by his companions: Aoi Mizusawa, Akira Kagetsuki, and Minami Wakaba. Together they take a step into the unknown, unsuspecting of the secrets hidden below the surface...

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

White Ash (ホワイト・アッシュ, Howaito Asshu, stylized WHITE ASH) was a Japanese rock band. Formed in 2006, the quartet was initially a cover band of Arctic Monkeys. Upon its release of the compilation album Love, White Ash disbanded in March 2017.

Members:
Nobita – vocals, guitar
Yama-san – guitar
Aya – bass
Tsuyoshi – drums

(Source: Wikipedia)
Animator and cg artist, not to be confused with producer [Shinohara Hiroyasu](https://anilist.co/staff/168652/Shinohara-Hiroyasu)
A Japanese video game developer and TV show producer. He is best known for directing the live-action visual novel 428: Shibuya Scramble, which is a prequel to the CANAAN anime.

Sir Brian Harold May is an English musician, songwriter, record producer, animal welfare activist and astrophysicist. He achieved global fame as the lead guitarist and backing vocalist of the rock band [Queen](https://anilist.co/staff/106090), which he co-founded with singer [Freddie Mercury](https://anilist.co/staff/173532) and drummer Roger Taylor. His guitar work and songwriting contributions helped Queen become one of the most successful acts in music history.

Sir Brian Harold May is an English musician, songwriter, record producer, animal welfare activist and astrophysicist. He achieved global fame as the lead guitarist and backing vocalist of the rock band [Queen](https://anilist.co/staff/106090), which he co-founded with singer [Freddie Mercury](https://anilist.co/staff/173532) and drummer Roger Taylor. His guitar work and songwriting contributions helped Queen become one of the most successful acts in music history.
